channel.title: From Another Planet: Mind-space-junks
channel.description: Recent content on From Another Planet: Mind-space-junks

item.title: About?
item.description: I am nobody. Just an another terrestrial from 90’s. This blog is a place where I throw out what I can’t keep in my head. Space junk.

item.title: Loop of Choices
item.description: “As a white-collar employee Stanley, only presses the buttons after commands he receives. One day he worried because he hasn’t received any commands and then realized his co-workers are gone. But no worries, a narrator appears to help him(?)” … Narrator tells Stanley exactly what to do. But how reliable is this voice-over? Why does Stanley need help? Or does he not have free will of his own? Doesn’t he make a choice in the end, whether it fits the narrator or not?

item.title: Stay Strong 101: Madonna
item.description: “It’s the summer of 2005, all the windows of our house were open (even if we’d be moved to next year) … As a gentle wind wanders through the rooms, that rhythm would never leave my mind, echoes in my ears: … Time goes by so slowly I don’t know what to do” Well, it’s really interesting to find that song playing on the radio and the artist who was singing, but maybe I’ll tell you next time.
